On Wednesday investors continued to watch the economic data.
Leading data reports on the calendar for the day included Mortgage Applications, the PMI Services Index and the Beige Book.
Mortgage applications gained with an increase of ….9%.
The PMI Services Index missed expectations and was also below the previous month's report.
The August report showed the index at a level of 5-.… which was just below the estimate of 5-.- and down from the previous month's report of 5-.4.
The Beige Book reported the outlook for economic growth as moderate.
Also noted in the Beige Book was the Federal Reserve's consideration of the November election and how it might affect the economy.
Large-cap stock indexes traded lower for the day after signs of slowing growth from the PMI Services Index followed Tuesday's weak services report and last week's lower reports on manufacturing.
A CNBC report Wednesday provided more insight on the day's trading and the Fed's outlook for the economy.
